content: I get so nervous before every flight. It's the takeoff that really gets to me.
I used to have flight anxiety, but I've learned to manage it with deep breathing and distraction techniques.
It's strange how the fear of flying can be so overwhelming, even when you know it's one of the safest modes of travel.
I avoid flying whenever I can. The anxiety is just too much for me to handle.
Flying makes my heart race, and I can't help but think about all the things that could go wrong.
I find it helpful to talk to the flight attendants and get information about the flight. It eases my anxiety.
I've been on countless flights, but my anxiety never seems to lessen. It's frustrating.
I wish I could enjoy flying like other people do, but my flight anxiety holds me back.
I always have to grip the armrest during turbulence. It's a nightmare for me.
